WRITING.TITLE: Unsettling/repressed hiking memory
WRITING.TEXT:
(Posted this some time ago but I guess I just wanted some more dialogue about whatever the hell happened)
Messing around on reddit, ended up on the search and rescue guy's posts and read some stuff. Oh boy did that shit bring up a super fucking repressed memory. Actually got sick to my stomach and all clammy/light headed. This is the incident, to the best of memory, that I experienced with my (now passed away) friend I'll call 'James'. The best cure is to talk about it, so yeah.
Early 2000's (wanna say summer of 2002) at an out of state campout for the Life rank and above Boy Scout members. Campsite was near the West Virginia-Virginia border, heavily wooded/mountain-ish land and oh so beautiful hiking areas. Our Scout troop was about half way into our week long camping trip when about mid morning, James and I left for our duo hike. We had spotted this small stream the day prior, about 10 minutes north of camp, and wanted to follow it east. We figured we'd use it as an easy to follow path back to camp, especially with the orange markers we'd put up. Even the adults we mentioned it to said it was fine.
The first couple of hours hiking next to the stream was wonderful, James and I cracking jokes, talking about girls etc. After a break for a quick lunch I figured we'd head back, but James noticed a pretty choice rocky hill. Some steep parts to actually climb but gradual enough to walk carefully if needed. I voiced some concern for getting away from the stream but James was a year older and I didn't want to be a wet blanket. I caved and followed after him.
I climbed up after him, slower than he had, and I lost sight of him since he continued on over the top. I felt my skin itching, like after you sweat a bunch and you lay on grass, but about 5x worse. I ignored it because itching and such was just thing when camping. Once I made it the top though, the itching stopped, I spotted James and more importantly took in the view. The overall area looked like a sort of bowl, rocky hills forming the outside and a relatively unrocky inner area/surface. The bottom was a grassy area the size of ~1/2 a basketball court, no trees except for a ragged car sized hole in the ground. James was already walking slowly down the hill, towards the center, but I didn't even call out to him. I just stood there staring at the fucking grassy area with that uneven oval hole.
Next thing I knew, my foot slipped, and I managed cut the inside of my mouth on my braces, blooding my mouth. The fresh wave of pain sharpened my senses and I fucking panicked. James was almost down at the bottom and I was already halfway down the hill somehow. I didn't hear anything, like anything, including the stream which should've been not ~30-50 yards away. I booked it down the hill and grabbed James pack and yanked him a bit to get his attention. He stopped but didn't even turn towards me. My mouth hurt too much to move it and talk, so I just kept hold of his pack and lead-dragged him back up the hill and down the other side.
It wasn't until back at the stream did I realize I had been and was still crying, like openly weaping. I thought it was just my mouth pain but I finally looked at James. He was white as a damn sheet, tears pouring down his face. We stayed like that for a bit and finally walked back to camp in silence other than a few quick comments to eachother. The odd part is the rest of the week was great, stayed with the group, and James and I just shrugged it off as semi-dehydrated/heat induced 'incident'.
Not much else happened in regards to the incident, got really into high school sports and dropped scouting. I did meet up with my old Scout friends at James' funeral the summer before college, which was particularly tragic because it was a suicide and the guy was always full of jokes.
Thanks for reading everyone, Richard

WRITING.TITLE: Quick Help on highlighted cell
WRITING.TEXT:
Hello and thanks in advance.
I would like to know the proper code-name etc for the following:
The user selects/'highlights' a particular set of cells. They then click a macro assigned button, which runs it's code but based on the selectes/ 'highlighted' cell range. The cell range will change.

WRITING.TITLE: Macro vba help: getting certain rows of data from a data table, into another excel sheet
WRITING.TEXT:
Basics: (I'll post a pic to clarify) 1) I have a large data table dealing Materials on one sheet. Each Material has several components (number varies) for each Material. Each component having data related to it (price, weight etc).
2) I'm trying to create a code that allows a user to put an 'x' or something on this Material sheet, then go to the Form sheet, and click a macro button. This then fills out the Form's appropriate spots with info from the Material sheet.
3) Had a vlookup set up for a simpler version of this. But this one has multiple components/rows for each Material (thus one 'x' would only look for a row).

Crap I wasn't clear. So column B is like Color, Taste, Size etc. Them in column C is the values that vlookup is bringing from another sheet. I've literally typed in N/A for cells that don't have a value.
So that's what I meant by 'hey aren't we targeting cells with a value of N/A'

Cool!
And since I'm trying to get rid of rows with N/A in a cell, should that be what I'm calling it in the macro?
So that line of code saying Application.WorksheetFunction.IsNA shouldnt it read Application.WorksheetFunction.IsN/A?
Or is NA in vba = N/A in a cell

Viper bro thanks a bunch! Modular chunks 'libraries' for sure is a solid idea.
One last request, how could I tweak it to actually only apply for a cetain range on said sheet. It's only one chunk of rows that needs the n/a deleting function.
Also, should the application.worksheetfunction.isNA be N/A?
Also what's going on with the LudicrousMode sub? (Solid name btw haha)
So basically it just hops down row by row, deleting said row if it detects a N/A in it?
Whoops yeh I thought I deleted old one

Material XYZ
A B Color: Red Taste: Sweet Cost: N/A Etc. Etc

Thank you in advance!

WRITING.TITLE: Question/Help needed: data table into a 'form' on another sheet, vlookup not as effective
WRITING.TEXT:
Hello there and thanks in advance!
So I have a large data table in one sheet that will be continually updated. Materials and their details going to the right in that same row. Different materials will have different details provided (columns are the type of detail provided "weight", "volume" etc) and if material doesnt have that columns' detail, a 'N/A' goes there.
Pre-setup a form with formatting etc on another sheet, with vlookup in place, so that x calls the material's data-row into the appropriate form sections.
Issue: The form will have rows with 'N/A' because not all materials will have the same details provided. How do I set up a macro/etc to get rid of N/A rows?
Is there other ways of taking one sheets data and calling into a form based on choice, allowing formatting etc.
Thank you again

3) No Salarian teammate! Mordin Solus was my favorite squad bro.
